shader_set_uniform_i.htm+html.head.title: shader_set_uniform_i.htm+html.body.p:87-3
shader_set_uniform_i: With this function you can set the value (or values) of a shader constant. You must previously have gotten the "handle" of the constant using the function shader_get_uniform(), and you will have to know what type of constant it is to pass the correct number of integer values through to it, ie: if you have a vec2 you will need to pass two values to the function.

shader_set_uniform_i.htm+html.head.title: shader_set_uniform_i.htm+html.body.p:89-3
shader_set_uniform_i: NOTE: All uniforms must be set after calling the function shader_set(), and before calling shader_reset().

shader_set_uniform_i.htm+html.head.title: shader_set_uniform_i.htm+html.body.table.tbody.tr.td:102-9
shader_set_uniform_i: The handle of the shader constant to set.

shader_set_uniform_i.htm+html.head.title: shader_set_uniform_i.htm+html.body.table.tbody.tr.td:106-9
shader_set_uniform_i: The integer value (or values) to set the shader constant to.

shader_set_uniform_i.htm+html.head.title: shader_set_uniform_i.htm+html.body.p:115-3
shader_set_uniform_i:
{ANY_CODE} shader_set(shader_Glass);
shader_params = shader_get_uniform(shader_glass, "u_vParams");
shader_set_uniform_i(shader_params, 0, 65, 255);
draw_self();
shader_reset();

shader_set_uniform_i: The above code will get the handle of the shader constant "u_vParams" ( a <tt>vec3</tt>), then set that constant to the given integer values.
